definition: to have a sense of shame
to know/to be aware
shame/disgrace
to have no sense of shame
to love learning is akin to knowledge, to study diligently is akin to benevolence, to know shame is akin to courage (Confucius)
pinyin: hao4 xue2 jin4 hu1 zhi1 , li4 xing2 jin4 hu1 ren2 , zhi1 chi3 jin4 hu1 yong3
containing_words.word: 好學近乎知，力行近乎仁，知恥近乎勇

sentences.english: She is making fun of you and trying to embarrass you into trying harder.
sentences.chinese: 她在取笑你並盡力讓你知恥而後勇。

sentences.english: How does man head for pride from shame?
sentences.chinese: 人們如何從知恥走向尚榮？

sentences.english: Mike is thick-skinned and never cares what others say.
sentences.chinese: 邁克恬不知恥，從來不在乎別人講什麼。

sentences.english: A holy and shamefaced woman is grace upon grace.
sentences.chinese: 聖潔而知恥的婦女，乃無上的恩賜。

sentences.english: She had brazenly admitted allowing him back into the house.
sentences.chinese: 她恬不知恥地承認了讓他回到屋裏的事。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
to be strict with oneself
honor and shame/sense of honor
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
evil conduct
to demote/to denounce
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
upright and outspoken
(literary) hypocrite/two-faced person
to advance prematurely
